citation.article-title: Enrichment and isolation of Acetitomaculum ruminis, gen. nov., sp. nov.: acetogenic bacteria from the bovine rumen.

p.s: Description of Acetitomaculum ruminis sp. nov.
Acetitomaculum ruminis (ruminis. L. gen. n. ruminis of the rumen)
Curved rods measuring 0.8 - 1.0 μm in width and 2.0-4.0 μm in length, often occurring in singles, pairs or small clumps.
Convex, circular, 2- 3 mm diameter, entire, translucent, tan in color, with a smooth surface (strain 40C had granular surface).
DNA base composition. 32- 36 mol% G + C.
Ferments formate, glucose, cellobiose, fructose and esculin to acetic acid.
Oxidizes hydrogen and reduces carbon dioxide according to the following equation: 4 H2 + 2 CO2 → CH3COOH + 2 H2O.
Grows in a mineral medium with H2 and CO2 or organic substrate.
Rumen fluid is stimulatory and may be required.
The rumen of a mature Hereford X Angus crossbred steer fed a high forage diet.
Strain 139B, deposited as ATCC 43876 and with the Upjohn Culture Collection as UC strain number 12185.
